sentences.english: Hindus are taught that “truth is one, the sages give it various names.”
sentences.chinese: 印度教訓示“真理唯一，哲人以不同名字稱謂之。”

sentences.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying.
And the Lord spoke to Moses in the desert of Sinai, saying.
sentences.chinese: 上主在西乃曠野訓示梅瑟說。

sentences.english: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 上主在埃及國訓示梅瑟和亞郎說。

sentences.english: The real association is with the instructions of the spiritual teacher.
sentences.chinese: 真正的聯誼是與靈性導師的訓示同在的。

sentences.english: Christians try to live out their lives following the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 基督徒力圖按照《聖經》的訓示去生活。

sentences.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses in mount Sinai, saying.
sentences.chinese: 上主在西乃山訓示梅瑟說。

sentences.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, and Aaron, saying.
sentences.chinese: 上主訓示梅瑟和亞郎說。

definition: without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to regard it as an honor (idiom)
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to move an army and send a general (idiom); to deploy an army/to send a team on a task
